list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The pedestrian shopping area has been closed off with bollards.

list_definition.definition: a short post on a wharf or ship round which ropes are fastened.

list_ex_of_english: Vehicular access to the area is limited by rising bollards.
Surely that depends upon the width of the bollards?
A recent variation of limiting traffic is the managed closure by using retractable bollards which are activated by designated card holders only.
Security bollards outside the entrance stopped the car from entering the terminal, although the doors were damaged.
They have an incentive to drive quickly and to take short cuts, often going round the wrong side of bollards or islands in the centre of the road.
Bollards are put in place in order to slow down the traffic which must pass between.
People are met there by bollards and lane restrictions and the ultimate insult of a toll charge.
Commercial properties in areas prone to ram-raids often erect strong barriers or obstructions, such as bollards, to discourage such attacks.
